org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read.transformer.barcodes

Class FixRawBarcodeTagsReadTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read.transformer.barcodes.FixRawBarcodeTagsReadTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.function.Function<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead,org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>, java.util.function.UnaryOperator<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>, org.broadinstitute.hellbender.transformers.ReadTransformer, org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.SerializableFunction<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead,org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>

    public final class FixRawBarcodeTagsReadTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.broadinstitute.hellbender.transformers.ReadTransformer
    Use different tags to encode and update the RTReadUtils.RAW_BARCODE_TAG tag (and RTReadUtils.RAW_BARCODE_QUALITY_TAG if requested). In addition, used tags are discarded because they are already encoded in the raw raw tags and they are not longer needed. This may be useful only in several cases: - When output a FASTQ file, some other tags want to be used into the read name. - For old BAM data where barcodes where stored in the deprecated tag SAMTag.RT. - When other tools were used to encode a read. For example, illumina2bam uses BC/QT to encode the first index/quality, and B2/Q2 to encode the second. By providing to this transformer a list with BC and B2 (and optional QT and Q2), this will encode properly in the BC tag the double index. Note: usage of this transformer is discouraged for other purposes, because it removes information encoded in other tags.
    See Also:
